summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from April 2021 between an FBI Special Agent and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding scheduling a meeting to discuss the Maxwell case. The emails show coordination between law enforcement and prosecution on next steps for the case.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York's office, corresponding with an FBI Special Agent to schedule a meeting about the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Office Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force, providing updates and coordinating a meeting time with a prosecutor regarding the Maxwell case.

connections.description: They are coordinating a meeting to discuss the Maxwell case, indicating a working relationship between prosecution and law enforcement.

events.title: Scheduled Maxwell case meeting
events.description: A meeting was tentatively scheduled for 10am on Tuesday (April 27, 2021) between an FBI Special Agent and an Assistant U.S. Attorney to discuss the Maxwell case.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
New York Office Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force
keyFacts: The emails show active coordination in April 2021 between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the Maxwell case.
An FBI Special Agent mentions having 'a few updates' on the Maxwell case but was traveling frequently at the time.
The correspondence indicates the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell was ongoing and required coordination between law enforcement and prosecutors.
